elements.name: CPCCO Note
elements.text: NOTE: CPCCo staff must contact Liz Troller at 509-376-4060 to initiate a work release for HMIS staff prior to submission of this service ticket request for Environmental Services Clearance.

renderAttributes.data-help-text: Detailed description must include what the scope of work is, why, when, anticipated start date and duration. Example: "The installation, maintenance, and repair of an anode bed at the Hazardous Materials Management and Emergency Response (HAMMER) Training and Education Center in the 600 Area of the Hanford Site. The anode bed is part of an impressed current cathodic protection system. An impressed cathodic protection system uses a rectifier to convert alternating current to direct current. This current is sent through an insulated wire to the anodes buried in the soil. The current then flows through the soil to the pipe system, and then returns to the rectifier through the insulated wire attached to the pipes. The pipes are protected because the current going to the pipe system overcomes the corrosion-causing current normally flowing away from it. The anodes will be arranged within two excavated trenches. Excavation dimensions will be approximately 15.2 meters (50 feet) long by 6.1 meters (20 feet) wide by 3 meters (10 feet) deep. The excavation will require use of tracked or rubber tired equipment. The anodes will be placed within the trenches and then backfilled. Maintenance and repair of the anode bed will need to occur throughout the life of the anode bed/cathodic protection system."

elements.name: Project Description Note
elements.text: Any scope or project dimension changes more than 5 working days from original ticket submission may require a new ticket to be submitted and cancelation of the original submission.

renderAttributes.data-help-text: Include ALL work areas including staging and stockpile areas, utility corridors and access roads. Example: "The project is approximately 0.146 hectares (0.36acres) in size located east of Daughtery Loop, west of the HAMMER fenceline, and south of the 6092N Building in a graveled lot. The project area is comprised of a 53.3 meter (175 foot) by 27.4 meter (90 foot) area required to install the anode bed.  All excavation and ground disturbance associated with project activities will remain within the project area identified on the supplied maps. Access to the project area will be through existing graveled/paved roadways, parking lots, and walk ways."

elements.name: Length Width and Depth of Excavation
elements.label: Length, Width, and Depth of Excavation(s)

constraints.content: new Date(new Date().getFullYear(),new Date().getMonth() , new Date().getDate()+14) <= new Date(values('Requested Due Date').split('-')[0],values('Requested Due Date').split('-')[1]-1,values('Requested Due Date').split('-')[2])
constraints.message: Requested Due Date must be at least 14 days in the future.

elements.name: Date Note
elements.text:
When selecting a date, please allow at least 14 working days.
(More than 60% of reviews take at least 90 days to complete)

elements.name: Contractor For Whom Work is Being Performed
elements.label: Please identify the contractor for whom work is being performed:

elements.name: EIS GPS Support Needed
elements.label: Is EIS GPS support needed to delineate or mark project boundaries  or create project map in support of this request?

elements.name: Map Note
elements.text:
All requests must include a project map. The project boundary must be clearly identified and include ALL work, support areas, staging, and access roads.

Use HMAPS to create the map and attach below.

elements.name: Map
elements.label: Map
elements.requiredMessage: All requests must include a project map.
